verses.verse: "When <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> takes <S%H3947><s%> a wife <S%H802><s%> and marries <S%H1166><s%> her, and it happens <S%H1961><s%> that she finds <S%H4672><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> favor <S%H2580><s%> in his eyes <S%H5869><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> he has found <S%H4672><s%> some <S%H1697><s%> indecency <S%H6172><s%> in her, and he writes <S%H3789><s%> her a certificate <S%H5612><s%> of divorce <S%H3748><s%> and puts <S%H5414><s%> [it] in her hand <S%H3027><s%> and sends <S%H7971><s%> her out from his house, <S%H1004><s%>
and she leaves <S%H3318><s%> his house <S%H1004><s%> and goes <S%H1980><s%> and becomes <S%H1961><s%> another <S%H312><s%> man's [wife,]

and if the latter <S%H314><s%> husband <S%H376><s%> turns <S%H8130><s%> against <S%H8130><s%> her and writes <S%H3789><s%> her a certificate <S%H5612><s%> of divorce <S%H3748><s%> and puts <S%H5414><s%> [it] in her hand <S%H3027><s%> and sends <S%H7971><s%> her out of his house, <S%H1004><s%> or <S%H176><s%> if <S%H3588><s%> the latter <S%H314><s%> husband <S%H376><s%> dies <S%H4191><s%> who <S%H834><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> her to be his wife, <S%H802><s%>

[then] her former <S%H7223><s%> husband <S%H1167><s%> who <S%H834><s%> sent <S%H7971><s%> her away <S%H7971><s%> is not allowed <S%H3201><s%> to take <S%H3947><s%> her again <S%H7725><s%> to be his wife, <S%H802><s%> since <S%H310><s%> <S%H834><s%> she has been defiled; <S%H2930><s%> for that is an abomination <S%H8441><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> and you shall not bring <S%H2398><s%> sin <S%H2398><s%> on the land <S%H776><s%> which <S%H834><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%> gives <S%H5414><s%> you as an inheritance. <S%H5159><s%>

"When <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> takes <S%H3947><s%> a new <S%H2319><s%> wife, <S%H802><s%> he shall not go <S%H3318><s%> out with the army, <S%H6635><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> be charged <S%H5674><s%> with any <S%H3605><s%> duty; <S%H1697><s%> he shall be free <S%H9345><s%> at home <S%H1004><s%> one <S%H259><s%> year <S%H8141><s%> and shall give <S%H8055><s%> happiness <S%H8055><s%> to his wife <S%H802><s%> whom <S%H834><s%> he has taken. <S%H3947><s%>

"No <S%H3808><s%> one shall take <S%H9111><s%> a handmill <S%H7347><s%> or an upper <S%H7393><s%> millstone <S%H7393><s%> in pledge, <S%H9111><s%> for he would be taking <S%H9111><s%> a life <S%H5315><s%> in pledge. <S%H9111><s%>

"If <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> is caught <S%H4672><s%> kidnapping <S%H1589><s%> any <S%H5315><s%> of his countrymen <S%H251><s%> of the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> and he deals <S%H9417><s%> with him violently, <S%H9417><s%> or sells <S%H4376><s%> him, then that thief <S%H1590><s%> shall die; <S%H4191><s%> so you shall purge <S%H1197><s%> the evil <S%H9563><s%> from among <S%H7130><s%> you.

"Be careful <S%H8104><s%> against an infection <S%H5061><s%> of leprosy, <S%H6883><s%> that you diligently <S%H3966><s%> observe <S%H8104><s%> and do <S%H6213><s%> according to all <S%H3605><s%> that the Levitical <S%H3881><s%> priests <S%H3548><s%> shall teach <S%H3384><s%> you; as I have commanded <S%H6680><s%> them, so you shall be careful <S%H8104><s%> to do. <S%H6213><s%>

"Remember <S%H2142><s%> what <S%H834><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%> did <S%H6213><s%> to Miriam <S%H4813><s%> on the way <S%H1870><s%> as you came <S%H3318><s%> out of Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>

"When <S%H3588><s%> you make <S%H5383><s%> your neighbor <S%H7453><s%> a loan <S%H4859><s%> of any <S%H3972><s%> sort, <S%H3972><s%> you shall not enter <S%H935><s%> his house <S%H1004><s%> to take <S%H5670><s%> his pledge. <S%H5667><s%>

"You shall remain <S%H5975><s%> outside, <S%H2351><s%> and the man <S%H376><s%> to whom <S%H834><s%> you make <S%H5383><s%> the loan <S%H5383><s%> shall bring <S%H3318><s%> the pledge <S%H5667><s%> out to you.
"And if <S%H518><s%> he is a poor <S%H6041><s%> man, <S%H376><s%> you shall not sleep <S%H7901><s%> with his pledge. <S%H5667><s%>

"When the sun <S%H8121><s%> goes <S%H935><s%> down you shall surely <S%H7725><s%> return <S%H7725><s%> the pledge <S%H5667><s%> to him, that he may sleep <S%H7901><s%> in his cloak <S%H8008><s%> and bless <S%H1288><s%> you; and it will be righteousness <S%H6666><s%> for you before <S%H6440><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> your God. <S%H430><s%>

"You shall not oppress <S%H6231><s%> a hired <S%H7916><s%> servant <S%H7916><s%> [who <S%H834><s%> is] poor <S%H6041><s%> and needy, <S%H34><s%> whether <S%H4480><s%> [he is] one of your countrymen <S%H251><s%> or <S%H176><s%> one of your aliens <S%H1616><s%> who is in your land <S%H776><s%> in your towns. <S%H8179><s%>

"You shall give <S%H5414><s%> him his wages <S%H7939><s%> on his day <S%H3117><s%> before the sun <S%H8121><s%> sets, <S%H935><s%> for he is poor <S%H6041><s%> and sets <S%H5375><s%> his heart <S%H5315><s%> on it; so that he may not cry <S%H7121><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> you to the Lord <S%H3068><s%> and it become <S%H1961><s%> sin <S%H2399><s%> in you.

"Fathers shall not be put <S%H1><s%> to death <S%H4191><s%> for [their] sons, <S%H4191><s%> nor <S%H1121><s%> shall sons <S%H3808><s%> be put <S%H1121><s%> to death <S%H4191><s%> for [their] fathers; everyone <S%H4191><s%> shall be put <S%H1><s%> to death <S%H376><s%> for his own sin. <S%H4191><s%>

"You shall not pervert <S%H5186><s%> the justice <S%H4941><s%> due an alien <S%H1616><s%> [or] an orphan, <S%H3490><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> take <S%H9111><s%> a widow's garment <S%H899><s%> in pledge. <S%H9111><s%>

"But you shall remember <S%H2142><s%> that you were a slave <S%H5650><s%> in Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> and that the Lord <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%> redeemed <S%H6299><s%> you from there; <S%H8033><s%> therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> I am commanding <S%H6680><s%> you to do <S%H6213><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> thing. <S%H1697><s%>

"When <S%H3588><s%> you reap <S%H7114><s%> your harvest <S%H7105><s%> in your field <S%H7704><s%> and have forgotten <S%H7911><s%> a sheaf <S%H6016><s%> in the field, <S%H7704><s%> you shall not go <S%H7725><s%> back <S%H7725><s%> to get <S%H3947><s%> it; it shall be for the alien, <S%H1616><s%> for the orphan, <S%H3490><s%> and for the widow, <S%H490><s%> in order <S%H4616><s%> that the Lord <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%> may bless <S%H1288><s%> you in all <S%H3605><s%> the work <S%H4639><s%> of your hands. <S%H3027><s%>

"When <S%H3588><s%> you beat <S%H2251><s%> your olive <S%H2132><s%> tree, <S%H2132><s%> you shall not go <S%H9443><s%> over <S%H9443><s%> the boughs <S%H9443><s%> again; <S%H310><s%> it shall be for the alien, <S%H1616><s%> for the orphan, <S%H3490><s%> and for the widow. <S%H490><s%>

"When <S%H3588><s%> you gather <S%H1219><s%> the grapes of your vineyard, <S%H3754><s%> you shall not go <S%H5953><s%> over <S%H5953><s%> it again; <S%H310><s%> it shall be for the alien, <S%H1616><s%> for the orphan, <S%H3490><s%> and for the widow. <S%H490><s%>

"And you shall remember <S%H2142><s%> that you were a slave <S%H5650><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt; <S%H4714><s%> therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> I am commanding <S%H6680><s%> you to do <S%H6213><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> thing. <S%H1697><s%>
